to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: finding programs using debian?
body:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

If you're asking if it is possible to find out which package a binary in /bin,
/sbin, /usr/bin, /usr/sbin belongs to, then the answer is yes. You
need to install apt-file, then read up on how to use it.

Greg



On Tue, Jun 12, 2007 at 03:01:40PM -0600, Littlefield, Tyler wrote:
> Hello list,
> Is there a way to find out which package a program belongs to with apt?
> TRhanks,
> Thanks,
> ~~TheCreator~~
> [My programs don't have bugs; just randomly added features]
